title: Electricity generators set for £1bn windfall after EU ruling
text:
UK power generators are set for a £1bn Christmas bonus after the European Commission ruled on Thursday that the country’s controversial electricity back-up system did not break EU state aid rules.

The system - aimed at preventing blackouts during the winter - was frozen last year when the European Court of Justice mounted a shock legal challenge, arguing it was unfairly favouring fossil fuel producers and potentially breaking state subsidy rules.

They forbid member states from providing state aid, or subsidising companies, without approval from the European Commission.

But Thursday’s decision found that the back-up power scheme did not break these rules, freeing up nearly £1bn in deferred payments...
description: UK power generators are set for a £1bn Christmas bonus after the European Commission ruled on Thursday that the country’s controversial electricity back-up system did not break EU state aid rules.
